intro: Homalium senarium, commonly known as the gray-leafed evergreen. It is a tropical tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that often have a distinctive grayish or whitish underside. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by bright red or orange berries. It is native to Central and South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
